answers.answer: Hello.Do you have diabetes? Diabetes could cause a neuropathy like this. A second possibility is that of a pinched nerve. Do you get back pains ?Regards

i have never been tested for diabetes.i had a pituitary tumor removed almost 2yrs ago.my uncle &cousin on dads side have diabetes.dr test my urine have hi urine ph of 8.5  dont realy know what that means.i have faucet joint syndrome.could that be my problem?im 35 yrs old. should i get tested for diabetes ? thanks

Hello.Yes, you should get your blood sugar levels tested. Since you have a family history, you have a more chances of having diabetes than others. The symptoms do not seem to be related to the tumor resection.I can't say if it is due to the joints, but it is better to rule out diabetes first.Regards

question: i have pain in my elbow and it tingles to my hand.the tips of my fingers are numb.they are so numb i can bite the tips and barley feel it.this started a week ago.geting worse.the tingle was just a little above my wrist now at elbow.havent done anything to my arm or hurt it in any way.any ideas on what is going on.it feels like its asleep but wont wake up.been getting dizzy and swetty sick feeling.any ideas would help and ease my mind.thanks
title: tips of fingers  are numb
